title: Azure Data Engineer Financial Services
description:
Bouw mee aan de innovatieve oplossingen in de financiele sector. Als een data engineer analyseer, process en sla je data op in, naar en van de cloud platforms. * Uren: 36 – 40 uur * Werkplek: Amsterdam/Utrecht/vanuit huis Ervaring: Ervaren professional * In deze rol ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het verwerken van grote data van grote internationale organisaties. Daarnaast geef je leiding aan teams en creëer je herbruikbare data-oplossingen. Uiteraard heb je hierbij veel klantcontact waarin je hen adviseert over hoe ze de waarde van hun data kunnen maximaliseren.

Jouw thuisbasis bij Capgemini

Die belofte doen wij aan jou. Dat begint al op dag één. Met een goede onboarding en gestructureerde en transparante groeipaden. Maar ook: volop mogelijkheden om daarvan af te wijken, zelf te pionieren en je eigen weg te kiezen. Daarbij kun je van onze kant rekenen op grenzeloos vertrouwen én collegiale support. Werken bij Capgemini betekent ook werken in het internationale hart van de innovatie. De eredivisie van de technologie. Een werkgever met oog voor jou en het vizier op de toekomst, waarin duurzaamheid en diversiteit en inclusie de hoofdrollen spelen.

Benefits

* Direct een vast contract en een passend salaris. * Onbeperkt trainingen volgen bij onze Academy. * 26 vakantiedagen. Zin in een extra veel vrije tijd? Koop dan dagen bij. * Capgemini draagt bij aan jouw pensioen. Daarnaast heb je ook de vrijheid om hier zelf nog extra aan bij te dragen. * Werken waar je maar wilt met onze connectiviteits- en thuiswerkvergoeding. * Een snelle laptop en een simkaart die je ook privé mag gebruiken. Een leaseauto, NS-businesscard of uitbetaling van je reiskostenvergoeding. *

Wat breng je mee?

Kun je er hier ook één of meer van afvinken? Dan ontmoeten we je graag! * Werkervaring with cloud-based data services en designing/building data stores/environments in de cloud. * Grondslagen in Data Management, processing en data moddeling technieken. * Werkervaring met Python. * Werkervaring met DevOps tool. * Werkervaring met Azure Databricks, PySpark, Synapse, Azure Data Factory(ADF), Azure DevOps, Python, ETL, Azure SQL Azure Data Lake Storage(ADLS), CICD pipelines. Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal. * Heb je nog vragen over de vacature? Neem dan contact op met jouw recruiter, Mustafa Ajiach.
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Data Engineer**In het kort**
---------------


Wij zijn de digitale motor van Hypotheken!


Dit team werkt aan de inrichting van een volledig functionerend data ecosysteem. Zowel binnen als buiten hypotheken wordt data makkelijk gedeeld vanuit één platform, data users kunnen terecht op deze ene plek. Buiten hypotheken zorgen we voor synergie door alle relevante data te delen zodat onze klanten en partners ons ervaren als een persoonlijke bank in een digitale tijd.


Als Data Engineer ga je samen met een enthousiast en gedreven team van Engineers aan de slag om nog meer waarde te halen uit deze data. De sfeer op onze afdeling is gezellig en ontspannen – je hoeft bij ons niet bang te zijn voor een pakkencultuur. Maak werk van je doelen en ontwikkel je zowel professioneel als persoonlijk. Passie voor je vak, ondernemerschap en vakmanschap vinden wij belangrijk op de afdeling. De cultuur is informeel, wij zijn open naar elkaar, vieren successen en organiseren regelmatig afdelingsuitjes.

**Je werk**
-----------


Data wordt steeds belangrijker. Het hebben van de juiste data op de juiste plaats op het juiste moment met de juiste kwaliteit wordt steeds belangrijker voor het ondersteunen van zakelijke beslissingen, optimalisatie, automatisering. Met het steeds groeiende belang van data voor onze innovaties en bedrijfsvoering willen we de overstap maken naar een gedistribueerde Data-Mesh architectuur geïmplementeerd op een nieuwe Azure based technology stack. Hiermee willen we nog beter voorbereid zijn op de toekomst. De Data Engineer die wij zoeken gaat deel uit maken van Enabling team. We gaan bouwen aan generieke componenten voor data teams.


Specifiek zijn we op zoek naar een Data Engineer die ons kan helpen bij de volgende activiteiten:


Realiseren van de hiervoor genoemde architectuur met een op Microsoft Azure gebaseerde technology stack en op basis van Cloud Native concepten. Concreet: realiseren van de data platforms, de CI/CD-pipelines hiervoor en data pipelines. Waar mogelijk conform de architectuur, waar nodig in overleg de architectuur bijstellen.


Integreren en realiseren van koppelingen met meer traditionele dataleveranciers en afnemers. Dit kunnen services zijn, streaming data, maar in enkele gevallen misschien ook nog wel een legacy systeem met een batch koppeling met CSV-bestanden. Concreet: integreren van systemen tot een totaaloplossing.


Migreren van bestaande data-oplossingen naar de nieuwe Azure-oplossingen. Concreet: realiseren van betrouwbare migratiepatronen om (veelal) een geleidelijke migratie mogelijk te maken.


On-call support leveren tijdens werktijden als roulerende taak binnen het team.

**Je profiel**
--------------

  

* Je hebt een academisch / HBO opleidings- en werkniveau;
* Je bent ondernemend, analytisch en pragmatisch;
* Je bent communicatief vaardig;
* Je hebt een gezonde passie voor innovatieve ontwikkeling en durft experimenten aan te gaan;
* Je hebt oog voor de life-cycle ontwikkeling en je zorgt voor duurzame oplossingen.
* Je hebt een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal zowel in woord als geschrift.
* Je hebt ervaring met werken in Scrum/Agile teams;
* Je hebt ervaring met Git en het bouwen van CI/CD-pipelines, bij voorkeur in Azure Devops/Azure Pipelines;
* Je hebt ervaring in Python, bij voorkeur met Object Oriented Programming, Pytest, prototypes en properties;
* Je hebt ervaring met SQL of PySpark, bij voorkeur in Databricks;
* Je hebt ervaring met Infrastructure as Code en Docker is een pre;
* Je hebt kennis en ervaring van Azure native componenten, zoals Event Hub, Data Lake Storage, Azure Functions, Virtual Networks is een pre;
* Je hebt Azure Fundamentals (AZ-900) en Azure Data Engineering (DP-203) certificering is een pre.
**Wij bieden**
--------------

* De vrijheid om het beste uit jezelf te halen, flexibel te werken en veel ruimte om te groeien en ontwikkelen.
* Veel verantwoordelijkheid en een grote mate van autonomie.
* Een informele en ambitieuze werksfeer met veel ruimte voor initiatief en plezier.
* Een uitstekend salaris afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring.
* Een OV-jaarabonnement.
* Een uitstekende pensioenregeling.
**Interesse?**
--------------


Ben je geïnteresseerd? Reageer dan nu op deze vacature. Neem voor meer informatie contact via (icthr@nl.abnamro.com). We maken graag kennis met je.

**Gelijke kansen voor iedereen**
--------------------------------


Het succes van onze organisatie staat of valt met de kwaliteit van onze mensen en de ideeen die zij hebben. Echt verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen voor onze klanten ontstaan door een samenspel van culturen, kennis en ervaring. Daarom is diversiteit voor onze organisatie ontzettend belangrijk. Om ervoor te zorgen dat alle collega's binnen ABN AMRO hun kwaliteiten kunnen ontplooien, stimuleren we een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zich betrokken en gewaardeerd voelt.

**Disclaimer externe recruitmentbureaus**
-----------------------------------------


Externe recruitmentbureaus dienen een overeenkomst met ABN AMRO BANK N.V. te hebben getekend, uitgegeven door een Talent Acquisition Specialist, om CV's te mogen indienen. Daarbij mag alleen een CV worden ingediend wanneer het bureau is uitgenodigd door een Talent Acquisition Specialist om mee te zoeken naar geschikte kandidaten. Alle ongevraagde CV's die buiten deze voorwaarden worden aangeboden zullen als eigendom van ABN AMRO BANK N.V. worden beschouwd. ABN AMRO BANK N.V. is hierbij geen plaatsingskosten verschuldigd.

### **Wij vragen**

* Passie voor je vakgebied
* Een ondernemende houding

title: Senior Model Dev Ops Engineer
description:
**At the heart of Rabobank**


Working at the heart of the bank where you can make a difference in the direction the bank needs to go. You help our squads with the exciting task of protecting our customers. Do you want to make a difference as a DevOps engineer in the Area Sanction Detection? Our systems and models monitor and protect 24/7 our payment streams and channels. As a DevOps Engineer you will be at that starting point together with the best colleagues from the FEC industry. With them, you will bring our IT to the next level. And that is only the beginning. We are looking for a DevOps engineer in an agile team. Specifically, we're looking for a passionate problem-solver with an affinity for FEC and Sanction Detection.


**Who are you?**


An experienced DevOps engineer who gets energy from improving and simplifying a complex architecture, to manage the security and our deployments and still be cost-effective. Innovation is key to come with smart improvements. You get energy when you make the IT landscape faster by automation. You bring in new ideas to improve. You get energy when you see a large IT landscape that needs to be improved. With your knowledge and experience of Azure, you can implement the proposals together with your colleagues.

**Together we achieve more than alone**


The Sanction Detection team of FEC isn't just a team; it fuels the Sanction Analysts with critical FEC/Sanction alerts. You support the IT teams and help them control the progress of the (software) DevOps processes. You are self-aware, you know your unique qualities and you know how to use them as effectively as possible. You are a proactive team player who immediately sees what a team needs to accelerate.


In the roadmap for this year, several functional and infrastructure changes are planned for the Transaction Filtering/ Namescreening squads. This means that during the development of the new system, the current system still needs to be maintained and LCM stays a top priority. Because of these priorities, we are looking for a Dev Ops Engineer, specifically with a high technical level. So, if you're ready to be part of a transformative journey, where every day brings new challenges, and every challenge brings unparalleled growth, then look no further.


We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So, we are very curious about what you can bring to our team. Working together is the way we work; as 1 passionate, results-driven, and analytical team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members, and partners, we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands, we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work, and do business.

**You and your talent**

* English is mandatory
* Bachelor's or master's degree in IT
* Minimum of 3 years of experience with Agile Way of Working
* Minimum of 3 years of experience with Azure products and development, more specifically: Azure Data Bricks / Azure Functions Core Tools / Azure webservices / Azure DevOps and CI/CD
* Experience with python and pyspark
* Experience with Power BI
* Experience with Linux
* Passion for Security topics like Vulnerability Management, Azure compliance and please show your certifications on for example Azure
* Good communication skills
* Great collaboration, and planning skills

**This is what we offer you**

* a gross monthly salary between €4.292,- and €6.130,- (scale 9, 36 hours per week (40 hours is possible)).
* 13th month and holiday pay: the holiday allowance and annual allowance will usually be paid out in 12 equal monthly installments. Employees have the option once a year to opt for the holiday allowance to be paid out in May and the annual allowance in December.
* an Employee Benefit Budget (11% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions, or even receiving a monthly cash payout.
* an annual personal development/training budget of € 1.400,-
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance.
* an attractive pension fund with a personal contribution of only 5.5%. Rabobank will contribute 21.5%.


This is a selection of the terms of employment for a DevOps Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.


Everyone is different, and it is exactly those differences that help us become an even better bank. That's why we want to know who you really are!

**You and the job application process**

* We appreciate receiving your motivation in written form for this role.
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Reach out to Charlotte Bos, IT Recruiter, via Charlotte.Bos@rabobank.nl
* The interviews are conducted through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Azure Data Engineer
description:
Are you looking for a challenging role, within a dynamic company, in designing, building, implementing and maintaining a robust data-infrastructure on the Azure-platform? In that case, Athora is looking for you!

  

As one of the largest pension insurers in the Netherlands, Athora Netherlands, with Zwitserleven as its main brand, plays an important role in the lives of our customers. We take care of their income tomorrow. Therefore we regularly make choices that affect the world of tomorrow.

  

At Athora, we work on the best version of ourselves and on a culture in which 4 pillars of behaviour are central: Get the most out of yourself (and bring out the best in others), Stand for what you do (and do what you stand for), Go for the best (and make better what is good), Focus on results (because results give direction). In our organization, people, collaboration and focus on the customer are central. We work together in and to create an inclusive work environment where everyone can flourish.

 **Azure Data Engineer**



As Azure Data Engineer you play a key role in designing, building, implementing and maintaining a robust data-infrastructure on the Azure-platform. You will connect, structure and make data available in a way that gives our organization a competitive edge and become a truly data-driven organization. You optimize data flows for better performance and scalability and collaborate in multidisciplinary teams to transform organizational needs into technical solutions. You have at least 4 years of relevant work experience in a Data environment.

 **What do you bring?**


* Knowledge of Python (advanced, object oriented, design patterns)
* Knowledge of Databricks (Pyspark, Spark SQL)
* Knowledge of Azure Datawarehouse environment (DP-900, DP203)
* You are familiar with the application of common Data Lake and Data Warehouse patterns and methodologies
* Knowledge of Azure DevOps (Git, YAML Pipelines)
* Knowledge of the Microsoft BI stack:
	+ PowerBI
	+ Familiar with Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL)
	+ Familiar with SSIS/SSAS
	+ Experience with data migrations
* Agile Safe
* A good knowledge of the Dutch language in word and writing.

 **Competences**


* You like to come up with creative and innovative solutions and are result driven
* You value working and sparring with colleagues but can also work independently
* You are curious and always want to continue learning within your own field and also outside of it
* You have a good sense of humor!

 **We offer**


* A modern and dynamic work environment with great colleagues
* A good balance between working in the office and from your home
* Ample opportunity for personal development
* Flexible working hours with attention to health and vitality
* A good salary and a 13th month


**Due to holidays, applications will be reviewed in the second week of June. Thank you in advance for your patience.**

 **Interested?**



Apply now, and come talk to us en join the the innovative and passionate team!  

If you have any questions or need more information, please do not hesitate to contact Eveline via recruitment@athora.nl

 *Een Pre-Employment Screening is onderdeel van het Athora onboardingsproces.*

  



Athora is committed to diversity and being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more Diversiteit en inclusie (athora.nl)

title: Data Engineering Associate
description:
We are looking for a Data professional to join our Data Engineering team. As a Data Engineering Associate, you are responsible for turning our clients’ business a more data-driven one, where data is used to drive action in every team, every day.

**Who we are**
--------------

  


Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.  

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.  

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

**What we offer:**
------------------

* Interact with senior stakeholders at our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
* Working with Data Scientists to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.
* Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.

  




**What you will do:**
---------------------


* Engineer complete technical solutions to solve concrete business challenges in the areas of digital marketing, e-commerce, Business Intelligence, and self-service analytics.
* Collect functional and non-functional requirements, consider technical environments, business constraints, and enterprise organizations.
* Support our clients in executing their Big Data strategies by designing and building operational data platforms: ETL pipelines, data anonymization pipelines, data lakes, near real-time streaming data hubs, web services, training and scoring machine learning models.
* Collaborate closely with partners, strategy consultants, and data scientists in a flat and agile organization where personal initiative is highly valued.
* Share data engineering knowledge by giving technical training.
* Guide and mentor team members.

  



**What you will bring:**
------------------------


* 3-5 years of experience in data analytics.
* Understanding of data warehousing principles, concepts and best practices (e.g. ODS, data marts, data lakes, data vault, 3NF).
* Advanced SQL, data transformation and data profiling skills.
* Experience of building production ETL/ELT pipelines at scale.
* 1-2 years of hands on experience with Azure, GCP or AWS, Data factory, Databricks, Synapse (DWH), Azure Functions, App logic and other data analytics services, including streaming.
* Experience with Airflow and Kubernetes.
* Programming languages: Python (PySpark), scripting languages like Bash.
* Knowledge of Git, CI/CD operations and Docker.
* Basic knowledge of PowerBI is a plus.
* True engineering craftsmanship mindset.
* Passionate about continuous improvement and working collaboratively.
* Strong problem-solving skills, coupled with the ability to convey designs and ideas to a wider audience.
* Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research, Statistics, Business or other related technical disciplines (Master's Degree is a plus).



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**This is Adyen**



Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.



For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.


**Data Engineer**



At Adyen, we treat data and data artifacts as first-class citizens. They form our backbone and drive the business and product insights we generate. To this end, Adyen is looking for a Data Engineer to join our team in Amsterdam. This role requires a solid understanding of both the business context and its data needs, with a focus on building high-quality data pipelines on our Big Data Platform. As a Data Engineer at Adyen, you will be instrumental in maintaining our data infrastructure and ensuring smooth data flows across systems.


**What you'll do**


* **Collaborative Solution Development**: Engage with a diverse range of stakeholders, including data scientists, analysts, software engineers, product managers, and customers, to understand their requirements and craft effective solutions.
* **Quality Pipelines and Architecture**: Design, develop, deploy and operate high-quality production ELT pipelines and data architectures. Integrate data from various sources and formats, ensuring compatibility, consistency, and reliability.
* **Data Best Practices**: Help establish and share best practices in performance, code quality, data validation, data governance, and discoverability in your team and in other teams. Participate in mentoring and knowledge sharing initiatives.
* **High Quality Data and Code:** Ensure data is accurate, complete, reliable, relevant, and timely. Implement testing, monitoring and validation protocols for your code and data, leveraging tools such as Pytest.
* **Performance Optimization**: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in data pipelines and systems. Improve query performance and resource utilization to meet SLAs and performance requirements, using technologies Spark optimizations.


**Who you are**


* **Experienced in Big Data:** Around 5 years of experience working as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* **Data & Engineering practices:** You have a solid understanding of both Software and Data Engineering practices.
* **Technical Super Star:** Proficient in tools and languages such as: Python, PySpark, Airflow, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, SQL, Git.
* **Clear Communicator:** Able to effectively communicate complex data-related concepts and outcomes to a diverse range of stakeholders.
* **Self-starter:** Capable of identifying opportunities, devizing solutions, and handling projects independently.
* **Innovator:** You have an experimental mindset with a 'launch fast and iterate' mentality.
* **Data Culture Champion:** Skilled in promoting a data-centric culture within technical teams and advocating for setting standards and continuous improvement.


**Data positions at Adyen**



We know companies handle different definitions for their data-related positions, this is for instance dependent on the size of a company. Since the birth of the Data Solution and the growth of all data streams, we categorized and defined all our positions. Have a look at this blogpost to find out!


**Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments**



Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you're from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.



Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!


**What's next?**



Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don't be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.



This role is based out of our Amsterdam office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.
company_description: The Only Payment Solution You'll Ever Need | Wherever People Pay

title: Data Engineering Lead
description:
We are looking for an experienced professional to join our Data Engineering Team. As a Data Engineering Lead, you are responsible for all data landscape and data processes of our clients. We are Azure oriented, but also we love open source and clouds such as AWS and GCP.

**Who we are**
--------------



Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.


With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.


We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.  



  

**What we offer**
-----------------


* Interact with senior stakeholders at our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
* Become the go-to person for end-to-end data handling, management, and analytics processes.
* Lead your team in creating the pipeline for Data management, data visualization, and analytics products, including automated services, and APIs.
* Working with Data Scientists to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.
* Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.

  

  



**What you will do**
--------------------


* Lead, influence & implement the technical roadmap of our clients, in light of overall technology and architecture roadmaps.
* Be responsible for the Architecture, making sure that technical and non-technical components work together in the product to deliver the customer needs.
* Lead and Develop the digital development and operations using Python, Spark, RESTful API, and Microsoft Azure Cloud, ideally with some Data Insights experience.
* Steer the technical excellence of the application and consistency with relevant digital frameworks, best practices, and standards.
* Coach and enable other product team members to deliver best-in-class products.
* Deliver data platforms, data insights and with the collaboration of the data science team – data products, such as recommendation systems, data lakes/hubs, data insights and dashboards.
* Lead project activities and will be responsible for the evaluation of business needs and objectives in collaboration with the project team and other stakeholders.

  



**What you’ll bring**
---------------------

* 5-8 years of experience in a similar role with experience in developing and deploying ETL solutions on Azure.
* Solid knowledge of data warehousing principles, concepts, and best practices (e.g. ODS, data marts, data lakes, data vault, 3NF).
* Good understanding of common platforms and practices regarding digital development; Cloud-based setups, Advanced Analytics and computing environments, and GitHub (or similar) and CI/CD workflows.
* Experience in setting up automated testing frameworks including unit tests, integration tests.
* Understanding of modern cloud-based architecture (Lambda & Kappa architectures).
* Advanced SQL, data transformation, and data profiling skills.
* Experience in building production ETL/ELT pipelines at scale.
* Data governance experience.
* 3-5 years of hands-on experience with Azure: Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse (DWH), Azure Functions, App logic, and other data analytics services, including streaming.
* Experience with Airflow, Kubernetes, Great expectations is a plus.
* Programming languages: Python (PySpark), scripting languages like Bash.
* Basic knowledge of PowerBI is a plus.
* Customer-centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services.
* Demonstrating true engineering craftsmanship mindset.
* Passionate about continuous improvement and working collaboratively.
* Strong problem-solving skills coupled with the ability to convey designs and ideas to a wider audience.
* People Management experience (at least 2 members team).
* Experience in service consulting and stakeholder management.
* Comfortable with ambiguity, highly autonomous.
* A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research. Statistics, Business or other related technical disciplines (Master's Degree is a plus).

  

In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

title: Senior Azure Developer Tribe CreditCore
description:
**Your work environment within Tribe CreditCore:**


Tribe CreditCore delivers centrally managed group functionality such that Business Units can optimally carry out their end-to-end credit process. We monitor quality of data and portfolios providing insight to continuously improve the end-to-end credit process. We increase trust from the regulator and from the public and we achieve uniformity, simplification and efficiency in the Credit Journey within the bank.


Through the creation of a central overview and by accurately monitoring the portfolios we offer actionable data to the group to improve quality of processes and decisions. Our credit risk framework is the foundation for clear and consistent implementations of global standards that adhere to regulation and ensures protection against inadmissible credit risk.


The area Credit Risk Origination and Services (COS) consists of 10 squads, organized around our purpose:


We create the best Credit Origination experience with central insights and innovative and compliant services, to better help our clients and select better clients globally.


Simplify, accelerate and harmonize credit origination across the business units, while enhancing Business Unit competitiveness.


As a Senior Azure Developer, you will be part of a diverse and enthusiastic team that takes ownership to deliver end-to-end solutions for a broad range of stakeholders. You bring your wide experience and knowledge to the team and contribute to increase the maturity of the team. You like to coach others and be a real team player that is used to working in a scrum team, has substantial knowledge about the scrum process and can work in a DevOps team.

**You recognize yourself from the description below:**

* 7+ years working experience as Senior Developer with knowledge on ETL processes and .NET (C#)
* Hands on experience with Azure Cloud services.
* Knowledge about architecting and developing maintainable and scalable software
* Excellent communication skills and a team player
* Experience in international IT projects English speaking and writing, (Dutch nice to have)
* Experience with the Agile way of working
* Experience with Azure DevOps
* Curious, analytic, pro-active, determined, result driven and not afraid to share his/her opinion

**Required:**

* Azure Cloud solutions (Azure App Services, Azure Functions, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks)
* Python, Pyspark, SparkSql
* C# (.NET Core/.NET 6 and higher)
* ASP.NET Core
* SQL, SQL Database / DWH
* Azure DevOps, GIT, CI/CD
* OOP principles, SOLID, DDD, Design Patterns
* Entity Framework (Core)
* Web API’s / Swagger/ REST / Open API
* Unit Testing / TDD / Mocking Frameworks

**Nice to have:**

* Knowledge of PyTest library
* Experience with YAML, Azure CLI, PowerShell
* Experience with Microservices
* Experience with finance or banking systems and processes

**This is what we offer you**


* a gross monthly salary between €4.292,- and €6.130,- (scale 9, 36 hours per week).
* 13th month and holiday pay: the holiday allowance and annual allowance will usually be paid out in 12 equal monthly instalments. Employees have the option once a year to opt for the holiday allowance to be paid out in May and the annual allowance in December.
* an Employee Benefit Budget (11% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions, or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out.
* an annual personal development/training budget of € 1.400,-
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance.
* a monthly € 40,- net work from home allowance, based on working from home 5 days per week.
* a monthly € 40,- net internet allowance.
* Attractive pension fund with a personal contribution of only 5.5%. Rabobank will contribute 21.5%.


This is a selection of the terms of employment for an Azure Developer based on a 36-hour working week (40 hours possible). You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.


**You and the job application process**


* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Dino Dzankovic, IT Recruiter, via dino.dzankovic@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
* A security check is part of the process.

title: Data Engineer | Conversational AI
description:
Data Engineer | Conversational AI**At a glance**
---------------


We are looking for an enthusiastic colleague that will help us shape the future of Conversational AI at ABN AMRO in the role of an engineering who can maintain and improve our Conversational AI workflows by automating the data and ml processes used within the team to improve solutions like Chatbot Anna, Conversational IVR (Voicebot) and LLM-based Advisor Assist.

**Your job**
------------


Thousands of customers interact with ABN AMRO on a weekly basis. We want to make sure that these conversations are getting resolved in an effective and friction free manner.


Here at Team Advanced Conversational Engagement, part of the Customer Interaction Domain, we maintain and innovate on top of our conversational bot, Interactive voice response (IVR), and internal Advisor Assist tooling.


In the Cognition team we are responsible for maintaining, enhancing, and innovating our conversational solutions to ensure they meet evolving customer needs and industry standards.


Subjects you might be working on include: Setting up a medallion data architecture for analyses workflows, implementing pipelines to evaluate LLM prompts, implementing pipelines to evaluate classification algorithms, design how we store and manually annotate data etc.


Most recently we are in a middle of a massive migration from a major cloud based conversational AI platform to MS Copilot while attempting to empower our solutions with LLMs in a manner that is responsible, secure and reliable within the standards of ABN AMRO.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


You will be part of a multidisciplinary scrum team of data scientists, engineers and consultants.


In the extended team (~50 colleagues) you will be working alongside data engineers, user experience designers, content writers and front- and backend developers.

**Your profile**
----------------

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in a professional IT environment (you encountered GIT, CICD, OOP, unit testing, REST, SQL/NoSQL, docker);
* Able to effectively communicate (in written and spoken English) about your analyses and results;
* Strong programming skills with Python/Pyspark, focus on data (pre)processing and data handling;
* Databricks (delta live tables, compute, delta lake) or similar;
* Experience with a cloud environment (Azure);
* Pro-active, curious attitude and an excellent team player;
* Ability to independently take ownership over epics, plan and manage the epic and communicate with stakeholders;
**We are offering**
-------------------

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.
**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. In addition, a recruitment agency can only submit a resume when invited by a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the search for a right candidate. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of ABN AMRO BANK N.V. In this case, ABN AMRO will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

### **Wij bieden**

* Een procesmatige aanpak

### **Wij vragen**

* Een creatief brein
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
#### **Purpose of the job**

At SkyTeam, innovation takes flight like never before. Since we started back in June 2000, SkyTeam and our world-class member airlines have built a leading alliance connecting customers across a vast global network of more than 1,080 destinations and 750+ lounges in 180+ countries. We’ve achieved many ‘firsts’ together – SkyPriority, SkyTeam Rebooking, The Sustainable Flight Challenge to name just a few.  

  

As the world around us changes at lightning speed, our pursuit to create cutting-edge solutions for members and customers is relentless. We want to be recognized as the most customer-centric alliance, anticipating, and fulfilling extended expectations.  

  

We work daily to be a leader in truly advancing travel and mastering cocreation to empower SkyTeam members and partners to deliver ever more seamless, innovative, and sustainable experiences to customers worldwide.  

  

**Job Scope**  

This is a position within the Data & Analytics Team, directly reporting to the Sr. Manager Data Analytics.  

  

**About You**  

  

Are you passionate about data, and interested in developing your career in aviation? Are you eager to make a significant impact on the evolution of SkyTeam’s data strategy?  

  

SkyTeam has embarked on a data transformation journey, aimed at maximizing the value of data, leveraging them as a strategic corporate asset, driving decision making and enhancing operational efficiency. Our Data & Analytics team is playing a key role in making this happen.  

  

As an Analytics engineer, you will be part of a cross-functional team in charge of translating raw data into reusable analytic assets, not only for the different SkyTeam departments but also for member airlines. You will understand and anticipate both business and data requirements, identify how to optimally integrate data, evaluate analytic techniques, and develop reporting solutions that drive actionable insights, critical for decision making.  

  

In this role, you will contribute to improving the overall passenger and cargo experience, identifying and solving pain points throughout the travel ribbon, exploring and proposing options that can leverage data from the unique perspective of a global airline alliance.  

  

**Key Result Areas / Key Responsibilities**

  

* Take full ownership on the whole cycle aimed at gathering business and data requirements, designing, building, testing and deploying end-to-end analytical solutions, while implementing automated methods for data collection, reporting, and analysis in an assigned domain.
* Design and implement robust data pipelines to ingest, clean, transform, and integrate data in the most efficient way.
* Develop and continuously enhance comprehensive reports, dashboards, and data visualizations while providing support and training to end-users on how to effectively utilize them to drive decision-making.
* Maintain and optimize existing solutions, implementing best practices to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the whole data lifecycle.
* Utilize business analysis techniques to identify and explore the reasons behind pain points in the customer journey.
* Suggest and guide relevant usage of data to internal and external stakeholders, regularly providing support and promoting a data culture.
* Constantly monitor data availability from the different data sources, checking the reliability of solutions adopted.
* Contribute to define and implement new processes, guidelines and policies on data governance and data management.
* Manage relationships with external stakeholders, such as key vendors and providers, for maximum effectiveness and cost efficiency.
* Maintain and nurture relationships at all levels with each member airline, with a focus on data & insights stakeholders.
* *Responsibilities and tasks of the position are not limited to the above mentioned, and deviations can occur at any point in time as the position evolves and in concert with the manager*

  

**Must have:**  

Authorization to reside and work legally in The Netherlands on a full-time basis.#### **Your profile**

**Required Skills, Knowledge and Experience**

  

* Bachelor’s or Master degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics or a related field and experience in data analysis and reporting.
* Proven experience in data engineering, analytics, or a similar role, with a strong understanding of the full data lifecycle and best practices on data management.
* Experience with SQL, Python, PySpark or other programming languages used for data transformation, analysis, and automation.
* Knowledge of reporting tools, preferably based on Power BI (Microsoft Fabric).
* Ability to work independently, delivering assigned tasks systematically without additional prompting.
* Excellent time management skills.
* Ability to set priorities, while working in rapidly changing environments.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to effectively collaborate with different internal and external stakeholders.
* Multi-cultural awareness.
* Eager to learn, acquire new skills and keep up to date with the latest developments in your focus area.
* Confidentiality and discretion.
* General understanding of competition law implications.

#### **Why us?**

**SkyTeam will offer you a complete salary package that includes unique benefits:**

* **A challenging role** at a unique employer in the Netherlands
* **Salary:** a competitive monthly gross salary depending on your experience
* **Vacation pay**: 8% of gross annual salary
* **Vacation days:** 27 vacation days for one year
* **Birthday leave**: additional PTO (1 day) on or around your birthday
* **Public holiday exchange**: exchange Dutch bank holidays with any bank holiday culturally significant to you
* **Pension plan:** everything you need for a good retirement
* **Equipment:** laptop, phone or e-sim
* **Home office:** create and equip your home office with our support.
* **Travel allowance:** travel allowance for public transport, bicycle, and car
* **Discounted travel:** reduced airfares after 6 months of your start date
* **Learning environment:** free access to LinkedIn Learning, Lunch & Learn sessions, and the opportunity to surround yourself with highly skilled colleagues
* **Work from anywhere:** flexibility to work from anywhere in the world (duration of max. four weeks)
* **Hybrid way of working:** we offer flexibility to work from home
* **Fun events:** potluck parties, monthly after work get-togethers, BBQs, annual summer/winter events, and more appealing team activities throughout the year

  

**Application procedure:**  

  

Within a few weeks, we will assess your profile for this position, and should there be a match, we will contact you via email about the potential fit. If your skills and experience align with our needs, here is what you can expect:  

* Preliminary chat with the Recruiter (Virtual)
* First Interview: You'll receive an invitation for a first interview in-person at our office in Amstelveen.
* Second Interview & Case Study: You'll be invited to a second round of interviews at our office in Amstelveen if the first interview goes well. This stage may also include a case presentation, providing you with an opportunity to showcase your problem-solving skills and industry acumen. On very rare occasions, there might be a follow-up third/final Interview.
* Email Job Offer: Upon successful completion of the interviews, we'll present a job offer to you via email.
* Contract/Offer: Finally, with much excitement, we'll prepare a comprehensive employment contract formalizing your new role at SkyTeam.

#### **About us**


SkyTeam strives to provide the safest and most seamless customer journey of any global airline alliance. Our members work together to connect millions of passengers safely and seamlessly through an extensive global network. It is an esteemed international organization that brings together different cultures and backgrounds, all united by our passion for the airline industry. In addition to our focus on the passage side of aviation, we also focus on cargo.  

At SkyTeam, we know the importance of a fresh perspective. With members spread across five continents and different time zones, we are flexible and agile, focused on delivering services that create synergy. Our headquarters is a hotbed of innovation and creativity, allowing us to adapt quickly to the rapidly changing airline industry.  

  

SkyTeam's headquarters in Amstelveen represents more than 21 different nationalities. Our employees come from many different backgrounds and reflect the diversity of our member airlines. We are passionate about diversity and embrace an inclusive, non-discriminatory work community where we celebrate our differences and share our successes and hard work to contribute to member value.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
##### **Purpose of the job**

At SkyTeam, innovation takes flight like never before. Since we started back in June 2000, SkyTeam and our world-class member airlines have built a leading alliance connecting customers across a vast global network of more than 1,080 destinations and 750+ lounges in 180+ countries. We’ve achieved many ‘firsts’ together – SkyPriority, SkyTeam Rebooking, The Sustainable Flight Challenge to name just a few.  

  

As the world around us changes at lightning speed, our pursuit to create cutting-edge solutions for members and customers is relentless. We want to be recognized as the most customer-centric alliance, anticipating, and fulfilling extended expectations.  

  

We work daily to be a leader in truly advancing travel and mastering cocreation to empower SkyTeam members and partners to deliver ever more seamless, innovative, and sustainable experiences to customers worldwide.  

  

**Job Scope**  

This is a position within the Data & Analytics Team, directly reporting to the Sr. Manager Data Analytics.  

  

**About You**  

  

Are you passionate about data, and interested in developing your career in aviation? Are you eager to make a significant impact on the evolution of SkyTeam’s data strategy?  

  

SkyTeam has embarked on a data transformation journey, aimed at maximizing the value of data, leveraging them as a strategic corporate asset, driving decision making and enhancing operational efficiency. Our Data & Analytics team is playing a key role in making this happen.  

  

As an Analytics engineer, you will be part of a cross-functional team in charge of translating raw data into reusable analytic assets, not only for the different SkyTeam departments but also for member airlines. You will understand and anticipate both business and data requirements, identify how to optimally integrate data, evaluate analytic techniques, and develop reporting solutions that drive actionable insights, critical for decision making.  

  

In this role, you will contribute to improving the overall passenger and cargo experience, identifying and solving pain points throughout the travel ribbon, exploring and proposing options that can leverage data from the unique perspective of a global airline alliance.  

  

**Key Result Areas / Key Responsibilities**  

* Take full ownership on the whole cycle aimed at gathering business and data requirements, designing, building, testing and deploying end-to-end analytical solutions, while implementing automated methods for data collection, reporting, and analysis in an assigned domain.
* Design and implement robust data pipelines to ingest, clean, transform, and integrate data in the most efficient way.
* Develop and continuously enhance comprehensive reports, dashboards, and data visualizations while providing support and training to end-users on how to effectively utilize them to drive decision-making.
* Maintain and optimize existing solutions, implementing best practices to ensure data quality and integrity throughout the whole data lifecycle.
* Utilize business analysis techniques to identify and explore the reasons behind pain points in the customer journey.
* Suggest and guide relevant usage of data to internal and external stakeholders, regularly providing support and promoting a data culture.
* Constantly monitor data availability from the different data sources, checking the reliability of solutions adopted.
* Contribute to define and implement new processes, guidelines and policies on data governance and data management.
* Manage relationships with external stakeholders, such as key vendors and providers, for maximum effectiveness and cost efficiency.
* Maintain and nurture relationships at all levels with each member airline, with a focus on data & insights stakeholders.
* *Responsibilities and tasks of the position are not limited to the above mentioned, and deviations can occur at any point in time as the position evolves and in concert with the manager*

  

**Must have:**  

Authorization to reside and work legally in The Netherlands on a full-time basis.
##### **Your profile**


**Required Skills, Knowledge and Experience**  

* Bachelor’s or Master degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics or a related field and experience in data analysis and reporting.
* Proven experience in data engineering, analytics, or a similar role, with a strong understanding of the full data lifecycle and best practices on data management.
* Experience with SQL, Python, PySpark or other programming languages used for data transformation, analysis, and automation.
* Knowledge of reporting tools, preferably based on Power BI (Microsoft Fabric).
* Ability to work independently, delivering assigned tasks systematically without additional prompting.
* Excellent time management skills.
* Ability to set priorities, while working in rapidly changing environments.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to effectively collaborate with different internal and external stakeholders.
* Multi-cultural awareness.
* Eager to learn, acquire new skills and keep up to date with the latest developments in your focus area.
* Confidentiality and discretion.
* General understanding of competition law implications.


##### **Why us?**


**SkyTeam will offer you a complete salary package that includes unique benefits:**  

* **A challenging role** at a unique employer in the Netherlands
* **Salary:** a competitive monthly gross salary depending on your experience
* **Vacation pay**: 8% of gross annual salary
* **Vacation days:** 27 vacation days for one year
* **Birthday leave**: additional PTO (1 day) on or around your birthday
* **Public holiday exchange**: exchange Dutch bank holidays with any bank holiday culturally significant to you
* **Pension plan:** everything you need for a good retirement
* **Equipment:** laptop, phone or e-sim
* **Home office:** create and equip your home office with our support.
* **Travel allowance:** travel allowance for public transport, bicycle, and car
* **Discounted travel:** reduced airfares after 6 months of your start date
* **Learning environment:** free access to LinkedIn Learning, Lunch & Learn sessions, and the opportunity to surround yourself with highly skilled colleagues
* **Work from anywhere:** flexibility to work from anywhere in the world (duration of max. four weeks)
* **Hybrid way of working:** we offer flexibility to work from home
* **Fun events:** potluck parties, monthly after work get-togethers, BBQs, annual summer/winter events, and more appealing team activities throughout the year

  

**Application procedure:**  

  

Within a few weeks, we will assess your profile for this position, and should there be a match, we will contact you via email about the potential fit. If your skills and experience align with our needs, here is what you can expect:  

* Preliminary chat with the Recruiter (Virtual)
* First Interview: You'll receive an invitation for a first interview in-person at our office in Amstelveen.
* Second Interview & Case Study: You'll be invited to a second round of interviews at our office in Amstelveen if the first interview goes well. This stage may also include a case presentation, providing you with an opportunity to showcase your problem-solving skills and industry acumen. On very rare occasions, there might be a follow-up third/final Interview.
* Email Job Offer: Upon successful completion of the interviews, we'll present a job offer to you via email.
* Contract/Offer: Finally, with much excitement, we'll prepare a comprehensive employment contract formalizing your new role at SkyTeam.


Apply for this job
##### **About us**


SkyTeam strives to provide the safest and most seamless customer journey of any global airline alliance. Our members work together to connect millions of passengers safely and seamlessly through an extensive global network. It is an esteemed international organization that brings together different cultures and backgrounds, all united by our passion for the airline industry. In addition to our focus on the passage side of aviation, we also focus on cargo.  

At SkyTeam, we know the importance of a fresh perspective. With members spread across five continents and different time zones, we are flexible and agile, focused on delivering services that create synergy. Our headquarters is a hotbed of innovation and creativity, allowing us to adapt quickly to the rapidly changing airline industry.  

  

SkyTeam's headquarters in Amstelveen represents more than 21 different nationalities. Our employees come from many different backgrounds and reflect the diversity of our member airlines. We are passionate about diversity and embrace an inclusive, non-discriminatory work community where we celebrate our differences and share our successes and hard work to contribute to member value.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Translate this page
In het zuiden van Limburg ligt een mooie functie voor je klaar: Senior Data Engineer bij de afdeling Informatiemanagement inkomensverzekeraar Loyalis. Iets voor jou? Solliciteer vandaag nog op deze IT vacature!


Loyalis beschermt inkomens tegen onverwachte gebeurtenissen, zoals arbeidsongeschiktheid en werkloosheid. Bij dit sympathieke bedrijf kun jij aan de slag als Senior Data Engineer binnen het DevOps-team Datamanagement. Tot het eind van het jaar hou je je bezig met de lopende migratie van data en infrastructuur naar een Microsoft Azure Cloud-oplossing. Daarna richt je je op de doorontwikkeling van het Azure-platform en de bijbehorende rapportages. Kies jij voor een cruciale rol in het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen, testen en implementeren van cloud-gebaseerde oplossingen? Solliciteer vandaag nog en word Senior Data Engineer bij Loyalis!


***Dit ga je doen als Data Engineer bij a.s.r.***
-------------------------------------------------

* je levert samen met andere Ontwikkelaars, Analisten en de operationele teams innovatieve oplossingen die voldoen aan de vereisten van de organisatie
* je verdiept je samen met cross-functionele teams in de behoeften van klanten en vertaalt deze naar technische specificaties
* je ziet er op toe dat oplossingen die gerealiseerd worden binnen het DevOps-team voldoen aan gestelde normen, richtlijnen en architectuurprincipes
* je creëert en onderhoudt geautomatiseerde processen voor het bouwen, testen en implementeren van software met tools zoals Azure DevOps, Git en CI/CD-pijplijnen
* in je rol van richtinggevende sparringpartner voor andere Developers zorg je ervoor dat ontwikkelde oplossingen voldoen aan de gestelde normen en richtlijnen en aan de architectuurprincipes

***Deze vacature is echt iets voor jou, want jij***
---------------------------------------------------


* hebt een hbo- ofwo-werkniveau en minimaal 3 jaar aantoonbare ervaring met het ontwerpen, ontwikkelen, testen en implementeren van cloudoplossingen op het Microsoft Azure-platform, bijvoorbeeld als Developer
* hebt ervaring met de volgende Azure-onderdelen: Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure Delta Lake en Azure DevOps. Ervaring met Power BI is een pre
* hebt uitstekende programmeervaardigheden in Python/Pyspark en SQL
* hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden en bent oplossingsgericht en innovatief
* bent in staat effectief samen te werken met het DevOps-team en andere stakeholders

***Dit bieden we je***
----------------------


* een bruto salaris van €4.900 - € 7.000 op basis van 38 uur per week, een 13e maand en 8% vakantievergoeding
* een heel goede pensioenregeling met een hoge bijdrage van de werkgever. Plus een aantrekkelijke thuiswerkvergoeding en kortingen op verzekeringen
* bij a.s.r. zijn we flexibel in thuiswerken: we werken gemiddeld 60% thuis en 40% op kantoor en je hebt veel ruimte om je eigen werktijden te bepalen
* een NS-Business Card met vrij reizen (ook privé) of een kilometervergoeding
* veel aandacht voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling en vitaliteit
* werk waarmee je een positieve invloed hebt op de samenleving van morgen; samen stropen we onze mouwen op voor een eerlijkere en duurzamere toekomst

***Hier ga je werken als Data Engineer in Heerlen***
----------------------------------------------------

Je gaat aan de slag bij het team Datamanagement, dat een van de DevOps-teams is van de afdeling Informatie Management. Op deze afdeling werken ongeveer 50 collega's. Kenmerkend voor de werkwijze van Informatiemanagement Loyalis is: een agile mindset, sturen op agile principes, kort cyclisch werken volgens het scrum framework en het continu toevoegen van waarde voor de klant. Er is ruim gelegenheid om thuis te werken. Werken bij Loyalis heeft nog meer voordelen: volop opleidingsmogelijkheden, doorgroeikansen en een uitstekende werk/privébalans!


***Solliciteer op deze IT vacature***
-------------------------------------

Enthousiast geworden? Reageer via de button ‘solliciteer’. Wij geloven dat verschillen ons samen sterker en beter maken en voor ons tellen alleen je kwaliteiten. Daarom vinden we het prima als jij in jouw cv geen geboortedatum, geslacht en geboorteplaats opneemt.



Hier vind je meer informatie over het sollicitatieproces.



Neem bij vragen contact op met Renske Meijer (Recruiter): 06-82528238 / renske.meijer@asr.nl.

  

*Wij werken op een prettige manier samen met een aantal preferred suppliers. Acquisitie door werving- en selectie-, detachering- of uitzendbureaus wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld.*

title: Senior Data Scientist / Engineer Transaction Monitoring
description:
As a Senior Data Scientist/ Senior Data Engineer Transaction Monitoring you can have social impact, by catching the criminals using analytics models to analyse Rabobank transactions of 9+ million customers.

**You and your job**  

Preventing Money Laundering & Terrorist Financing is one of the key aspects for our society and our organisation, and as a bank we play a major role in this field. Within Rabobank we have built a data driven solution that analyses more than 11 million transactions per day to detect customers which launder money or finance terrorists. As behavioural patterns of criminals constantly evolve, our solution needs to adapt and evolve just as quickly. To keep our solution flexible and stable we need smart individuals like yourself who are passionate about building and improving our current Transaction Monitoring (TM) solution. One of the improvements we have identified for our solution is the introduction of more advanced analytics methodologies such as Machine Learning into our TM models.


To keep our Transaction Monitoring (TM) solution up to date to fight financial crime, you are passionate about data engineering, coding, designing and building complex (data) engines and related software infrastructure, solving (technical) performance and data-related functional challenges, helping colleagues to fulfil their (technical) requests and always looking for ways to do things smarter and better. This way you make sure Rabobank will be able to effectively fight financial crime!

**Practical examples**

* Develop and build scalable components (code bases) that allow for data processing and data generation on Big Data.
* Analyse source and output data to build knowledge and detect potential data-related problems.
* Anticipate potential future challenges of current infrastructure (e.g. performance issues) and together with the team design and implement solutions for these challenges.
* Test and monitor the performance of TM solution.
* Build a Machine Learning platform and orchestrating workflow of different models (ML Ops).
* Align with platform teams (which put code into production systems).

**Facts & Figures**

* 40+ other software engineers, data engineers and data scientists to collaborate with and learn from within the same team.
* 30+ other roles to collaborate with and learn from within the same team (e.g., Anti Money Laundering Experts, Analytics Translators and more).
* 44,000 Rabobank colleagues around the world.

**Top 3 responsibilities**

* Carry responsibility for (large parts of) the data and infrastructure of our TM solution, including infrastructure designs, good quality code and supporting your medior and junior colleagues to use best practices and follow the same way of working across the entire team.
* Lead alignment with adjacent fields (IT, Architecture, Data Science) to realize optimal performance of our data science model(s).
* Function as key counterpart for higher management.

**Together we achieve more than alone**  

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. So we are very curious about what you can bring to our team.


The 90+ people in our Transaction Monitoring team are responsible for detecting money laundering and terrorism financing risks, using analytics models. Working together is the way we work; as 1 multi-disciplinary, highly talented and motivated team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,500,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business.

**You and your talent**

* Academic degree (MSc / Phd) in Computer Science, Data Science, Econometrics or another STEM field.
* 5+ years’ experience in software development / data engineering / advanced analytics / Machine Learning (ideally with large data sets) working with Python and PySpark (Azure Databricks experience is a plus).
* Software development skills and good practices such as Git, release management, unit tests, testing strategy.
* Passionate about building large scale data solutions in an efficient and scalable manner.
* Analytical mindset and a critical way of thinking.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Motivation to catch criminals by making our TM system more effective.
* Structured, precise, communicative, can work well with different people and roles, pro-active, has a business focus, natural curiosity and can-do mentality to make the difference in fighting financial crime. Thrives in a high-impact, dynamic and high-paced environment.

**This is what we offer you**

* A 36-hour works week with a salary in scale 9 (€ 4292 – € 5811) or scale 10 (€ 5115 – € 6900) depending on your experience. A 40-hour work week is also possible.
* An Employee Benefit Budget 11% of your monthly salary. You decide how to spend this budget.
* Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance.
* Personal budget of € 1.400 to spend on activities related to your personal development and career flexible working times and location-independent working.
* Hybrid working (we work 1 or 2 days from the office a week) & flexible working times.

  

This is a selection of the terms of employment for a 36 hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on Employee benefits at Rabobank - Rabobank.  

  

**You and the job application process**

* Any questions about the job content? Contact: Nadia Vendrig, Expert Lead Transaction Monitoring Analytics via Nadia.Vendrig@rabobank.nl.
* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Lisa Boschma, corporate recruiter, via lisa.boschma@rabobank.nl. #LI-LB
* We will conduct the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/en/faq.
* A security check is part of the process.
* We respect your privacy.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
**This is Adyen**



Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.



For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.


**Senior Data Engineer**



At Adyen, we treat data and data artifacts as first-class citizens. They form our backbone and drive the business and product insights we generate. To this end, Adyen is looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our data solution in Amsterdam. We're looking for a person that understands the business context and the data needs behind it, and excels in implementing high-quality data pipelines on our Big Data Platform. As a Senior Data Engineer at Adyen, you will play a crucial role in shaping our data infrastructure and ensuring the seamless flow of data across various systems.


**What you'll do**


* **Collaborative Solution Development**: Engage with a diverse range of stakeholders, including data scientists, analysts, software engineers, product managers, and customers, to understand their requirements and craft effective solutions.
* **State-of-the-Art Pipelines and Architecture**: Design, develop, deploy and operate high-quality production ELT pipelines and data architectures. Integrate data from various sources and formats, ensuring compatibility, consistency, and reliability. Design scalable architectures.
* **Champion Data Best Practices**: Proactively establish and advocate for best practices in performance, code quality, data validation, data governance, and discoverability across Adyen through mentoring, training, and knowledge sharing.
* **High Quality Data and Code:** Ensure data is accurate, complete, reliable, relevant, and timely. Implement rigorous testing, monitoring and validation protocols for your code and data, leveraging tools such as Pytest.
* **Performance Optimization**: Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in data pipelines and systems. Optimize query performance and resource utilization to meet SLAs and performance requirements, using technologies such as caching, indexing, partitioning, and other Spark optimizations.


**Who you are**


* **Experienced in Big Data:** Over 8 years of experience working as a Data Engineer or in a similar role.
* **Data & Engineering practices:** You possess an expert-level understanding of both Software and Data Engineering practices.
* **Technical Super Star:** Highly proficient in tools and languages such as: Python, PySpark, Airflow, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, SQL, Git.
* **Clear Communicator:** Skilled at articulating complex data-related concepts and outcomes to a diverse range of stakeholders.
* **Self-starter:** Capable of independently recognizing opportunities, devising solutions, leading, prioritizing and owning projects.
* **Innovator:** You have an experimental mindset with a 'launch fast and iterate' mentality.
* **Data Culture Champion:** Experienced in fostering a data-centric culture within large, technical organizations and setting standards for excellence and continuous improvement.


**Data positions at Adyen**



We know companies handle different definitions for their data-related positions, this is for instance dependent on the size of a company. Since the birth of the Data Solution and the growth of all data streams, we categorized and defined all our positions. Have a look at this blogpost to find out!


**Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments**



Our unique approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds and cultures is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, and we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. No matter who you are or where you're from, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.



Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does this sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application!


**What's next?**



Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don't be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.



This role is based out of our Amsterdam office. We are an office-first company and value in-person collaboration; we do not offer remote-only roles.

title: Internship in Data Science
description:
**Please apply only if you are currently living in the Netherlands and you are still a student or you have graduated maximum 3 months prior to the internship start date.**


At Henkel, you can build on a strong legacy and leading positions in both industrial and consumer businesses to reimagine and improve life every day. If you love challenging the status quo, join our community of over 50,000 pioneers around the globe. Our teams at Henkel Consumer Brands continuously drive the evolution in dynamic categories: Laundry & Home Care and Hair. With our trusted brands, including Persil and Schwarzkopf, our cutting-edge technologies and our disruptive solutions, you will have countless opportunities to explore new paths and develop your skills. Grow within our future-led businesses, our diverse and vibrant culture and find a place where you simply belong. All to leave your mark for more sustainable growth.


**Do you dare to make an impact?**


#### **YOUR ROLE**


* As a **data science intern** in a global team, you have the opportunity to **dive deep into big data** of Henkel and extract firsthand insights.
* You will take the **end-to-end responsibility** of your project starting from **data analytics, data visualization to developing machine learning models**.
* **Communicating** with business stakeholders and translating their requirements into coding projects.
* Participating in developing different parts of data pipelines to **solve complex business problems.**
#### **YOUR SKILLS**


* **Master student in data related majors (data science, computer science, mathematics, operation research, or engineering).**
* Confident use of **Python** **and SQL** (Familiarity with PySpark is plus).
* Confident knowledge of common machine learning packages and algorithms.
* Experience with Azure ML studio is plus.
* Experience in one of the following areas is a big plus: LLM (GEN AI) or Time Series Forecasting.
* **Data analytics and ability to extract insights from raw data**.
* Available to start from **July 1****st** for 6 month full-time (Hybrid)

#### **OUR OFFER**


* Opportunity to work in a multi-cultural dynamic environment
* An exciting and educational full-time internship in an international FMCG business
* You’ll be part of an international intern
* communityFun and educational events organized for the international (BeNeFrance) intern community, with opportunities to broaden your network
* 6 months internship (possibility to extend for 2 more months, max. 8 months in total)
* An internship allowance of 1000 EUR gross/ month and a travel allowance of 250 EUR

**Henkel is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to gender, origin, culture, mindset, generation, disability, religion and sexual orientation.**



**JOB ID:** 24063388
**Contract & Job type:** Limited - Full Time
**Contact information for application-related questions:** recruitment.benelux@henkel.com
Please do not use this email address for sending your application or CV. To apply, please click on the "Apply Now" button below. Applications sent via e-mail will not be accepted.
